Description: Fragment of a vessel made of calcite. The base is flat and the vessel is roughly bowl-shaped with originally two opposite protruding pointed parts of the rim, one of them broken off. The interior of the bowl seems to have been circular in shape. The surface is well smoothed and mostly covered in a brown substance, except for an oval part on top of the protruding end which shows no brown substance.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Amara West (Nubia), E13.2, below level 3 floor
Bibliographic references: Spencer 1997 / Amara West I, The Architectural Report (p. 202)
